sen.j: 兼俊（けんしゅん、康平5年（962年） - 没年不詳）は、平安時代後期の真言宗の僧。
sen.e: Kenshun (962 - year of his death is unclear) was a monk of Shingon sect in the late Heian period.
Kenshun (962 - year of death unclear) was a priest of the Shingon sect in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: changed "monk" to "priest" for consistency with other articles;
sen.e: Kenshun (962 - year of death unclear) was a priest of the Shingon sect in the late Heian period.
His father was FUJIWARA no Kaneie.
His father was FUJIWARA no Kaneie
His father was FUJIWARA no Kaneie
His azana (Chinese courtesy name) was Enrin.
sen.cmt: changed "aza" to "azana"; While I do not understand "Chinese courtesy name" either, I feel obligated to look it up; "by-name" I simply don't understand (all information used is from <http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/cgi-bin/wwwjdic.cgi?1F>
字用語集の表記に従い、Chinese courtesy name を popular name に修正しました。

sen.j: 1006年（嘉承元年）大和国金峰山の鳳閣寺で伝法灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: He received denpo-kanjo (the consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma) in 1006 at Hokaku-ji Temple on Mt. Kongo in Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He received the Denpo-Kanjo (the consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma) in 1006 at the Hokaku-ji Temple on Mt. Kongo in Yamato Province.
He received the Denpo-Kanjo (the consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma) in 1006 at the Hokaku-ji Temple on Mt. Kongo in Yamato Province.

sen.j: その後は観法を修行し、霊験の証得に力を尽くした。
sen.e: Thereafter, he practiced kanpo (meditative training to reach enlightenment) and strived for attaining miraculous efficacy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: From then on, he practiced Kanpo (meditative training to reach enlightenment) and devoted himself to attaining miracles.
sen.cmt: "strived for attaining miraculous efficacy" does not make sense to me, so I changed "miraculous efficacy" to "miracles" for 霊験
sen.e: From then on, he practiced Kanpo (meditative training to reach enlightenment) and devoted himself to attaining miracles.
